Key Arguments: The bill threatens freedom of speech and could lead to a dictatorship-like control over what can be said or thought.
The legislation is seen as the biggest imposition on free speech according to lawyer Justin Quill.
The bill contradicts Articles 18 and 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, which protect freedom of thought, conscience, religion, opinion, and expression.
Freedom of speech is essential for discovering truth and fostering dialogue, which the bill would hinder.
The internet serves as a modern 'town square' for debate, and government control over truth is not the solution.
Notable Quotes: Lawyer Justin Quill says the proposed law is 'the biggest imposition on free speech that I've ever seen in a piece of legislation.'
Freedom of speech is the bedrock of a free and fair society. It is a fundamental value of Australia.
The internet has become the ‘town square’ where the latest ideas can be debated.
